text: This is actually the very first PSP game I played. I remember being impressed by the possibility of playing portable games with almost PS2-like quality, but for some reason all I remember about this game is that I enjoyed it for what it was. Key of Heaven was the game's name in Europe.
author: SupraDarky

text: SupraDarky I got lost a lot though I liked throwing the sword and the dialogue.
author: Mr. Variant

text: This game is hard as hell
author: Young Urd

text: I remember beating yen lan without even knowing how to do the charge attack. Once i saw other gameplay videos and realized how easy the fight should've been i was so salty.

text: That ending bit at 3:18 is really good.

author: NetConsole

text: The game had it's problems. The story could be a bit ham-fisted at times, and what should have been an interesting and complex sword combat system was a bit obviated by the "blow everything up everywhere" magic system that you charged out of combat. But dang if it still isn't one of the prettiest mobile games I've ever seen, and that soundtrack. Mmph. Gorgeous.
author: pianoguy222

text:
OMG This game, I used to play it all the time on my PSP back in the day :')

I loved the PSP, my favorite handheld, I need to get one.

text: It got that Far East vibe.
author: Philip J. Fry II

text:
Ori
Apologies. I seem to have offended you. Yes, vaporwave is a terrible way of making music. Yours is the only way.

I hope you also understand that both of my comments are a joke. I understand that sarcasm is a bit hard to detect in the internet.
